availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nicholasville, Kentucky, minister. Kentucky native. Son of Stephen Minor Yeaman and Lucretia Helm Yeaman. Married to Elizabeth Shackleford Yeaman in Hardin County, Kentucky, on December 10, 1850. Father of Stephen M. Yeaman, John B. Yeaman, Lucretia Yeaman, Mary P. Yeaman, Sarah E. Yeamann. Clerk in Hardin County, Kentucky in 1850. Baptist minister in Nicholasville, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin, District 3, p. 353A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine, Nicholasville, p. 114.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, Film # 000390788.
Find A Grave, "William Pope Yeaman (1832-1904)," Memorial #100836552, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100836552 (accessed May 24, 2019).
